intro: Myrsine rolletii, commonly known as the Madagascar myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Madagascar and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by dark blue berries. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
